School Lawsuit Is Settled Ending weeks of conflict with the state, the New York City Board of Education agreed to place up to 400 certified teachers this fall in vacancies at some of its worst-performing elementary schools. PAGE B1

Test Score Gap Widens A gap between the test scores of black and white students widened in the 1990's, with the average black 17-year-old reading only about as well as the average white 13-year-old, the government said. PAGE A14

Liberty Loses Opener The Houston Comets, seeking their fourth consecutive Women's National Basketball Association title, won the first game of the best-of-three final series, beating New York, 59-52. SPORTSFRIDAY, PAGE D1
